page.title: 08FLORA AND FAUNA continued
page.content: The word {Daisy}comes from two{Saxon} words{"days","eye".}The daisy is very common and flowers all year round. {The Buttercup}family is very large. There are the bolbous, the creeping and most common of all the meadow buttercup. {Primroses}are yellow ,pink or white and also have a tiny eye in the middle. {The Sycamore}is a very large tree and grows to about 35m. It grows mostly in the uplands of Britain. Their leaves are deep green and are deeply lobed. In Autumn the tree bears fruit that looks like a pea with wings. Sycamore buds are large and green. Most furniture these days is made from this wood.{ {Ash}trees grow to about 40m tall. Their leaves are large and leggy and grow in pairs. The buds are jet black.
